resources.description: Resource requests and limits for the container

cpu.description: Maximum CPU the container is allowed to use (e.g. 200m)

memory.description: Maximum memory the container is allowed to use (e.g. 200Mi)

requests.description: Guaranteed resources reserved for the container

auth.description: Auth configuration for integrating Platform Monitoring services via OAuth (currently supports IDP)

clientId.description: OAuth Client ID used to identify the client application

clientSecret.description: OAuth Client Secret used to authenticate the client application

loginUrl.description: Authentication (authorization) endpoint URL of the IDP

tokenUrl.description: Token redemption endpoint URL where authorization codes are exchanged for tokens

userInfoUrl.description: Access token validation or user info endpoint URL of the IDP

tlsConfig.description: TLS settings for secure communication with the IDP endpoints

caSecret.description: Kubernetes Secret containing the trusted CA certificate

name.description: Name of the Secret containing the CA certificate

key.description: Key in the Secret data that holds the CA certificate (e.g. trusted-ca.crt)

certSecret.description: Kubernetes Secret containing the client certificate

name.description: Name of the Secret containing the client certificate

key.description: Key in the Secret data that holds the client certificate (e.g. client-cert.crt)

keySecret.description: Kubernetes Secret containing the client private key

name.description: Name of the Secret containing the client private key

key.description: Key in the Secret data that holds the client private key (e.g. client-key.key)

insecureSkipVerify.description: Disable TLS certificate verification when set to true (not recommended for production)

basicAuthPwd.description: Password used for basic authentication (e.g. vmAuth) derived from the OAuth configuration

cloudEventsExporter.description: Exporter to fetch all Events and convert them to metrics

cloudwatchExporter.description: Exporter to request metrics from AWS CloudWatch about different AWS Managed Services

commonDashboards.description: Common dashboards that stored in Monitoring

fullnameOverride.description: Name to substitute for the full names of resources

privilegedRights.description: Indicates if monitoring-operator has permissions to deploy ClusterRole and ClusterRoleBinding resources.

profile.description: HWE profile name determining the scale of the deployment

goldpingerExporter.description: Exporter to check and visualize network connectivity between Kubernetes nodes and pods in the cluster

list.description: A list of Grafana dashboards to install

graphite_remote_adapter.description: Adapter to receive metrics using RemoteWrite from VictoriaMetrics or Prometheus convert them in Graphite format and send to Graphite/carbon/etc

integration.description: Platform Monitoring integration with external monitoring tools and public clouds (GCP Stackdriver, Jaeger)

stackdriver.description: Google Cloud Operations (GCO) integration via stackdriver-prometheus-sidecar deployed as Prometheus sidecar

image.description: Docker image for stackdriver-prometheus-sidecar container (deployed as sidecar to Prometheus pod)

projectId.description: Google Cloud project identifier where metrics will be sent

location.description: Google Cloud location/region where the project is deployed

cluster.description: Name of Kubernetes cluster in Google Cloud that will be monitored

metricsFilter.description: List of Prometheus instant vector selector filters for metrics to send to GCO. Uses Prometheus query syntax. https://prometheus.io/docs/prometheus/latest/querying/basics/#instant-vector-selectors

createGrafanaDataSource.description: Automatically discover Jaeger service across all namespaces and create Grafana datasource if found

clickHouse.description: ClickHouse Performance Dashboard Grafana datasource configuration

createGrafanaDataSource.description: Create Grafana datasource for ClickHouse Performance Dashboard

affinity.description: The pod's scheduling constraints. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/generated/kubernetes-api/v1.30/#affinity-v1-core

name.description: A name of a integration-tests microservice to deploy with.

nodeSelector.description: Defines nodes the pod is allowed to be scheduled to.

priorityClassName.description: PriorityClassName to be assigned to the pod to prevent it from eviction.

resources.description: Compute resources requests and limits. More info:https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/

customResourcePath.description: The parameter (optional) specifies the path to Custom Resource that should be used for the write status of auto-tests execution.

enabled.description: The parameter specifies enable/disable writing status of Integration tests' execution to the specified Custom Resource.

isShortStatusMessage.description: The parameter specifies the size of the integration test status message.

onlyIntegrationTests.description: The parameter specifies whether to deploy only integration tests without any component (component was installed before).

tags.description: Defines a set of test cases to run. Default: grafanaORtest-appORprometheus-adapterORsmoke

tolerations.description: Tolerations allow the pods to be scheduled onto nodes with matching taints.

jsonExporter.description: Exporter to request JSON from any URL, parse the response and expose it as metrics

annotations.description: Unstructured key value map stored with a resource that may be set by external tools to store and retrieve arbitrary metadata.

install.description: Allows to disable creation of KubeStateMetrics during deploy.

labels.description: Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) objects. May match selectors of replication controllers and services.

metricLabelsAllowlist.description: Comma-separated list of additional Kubernetes label keys that will be used in the resource labels metric. More info: https://github.com/kubernetes/kube-state-metrics/blob/v2.3.0/docs/cli-arguments.md

namespaces.description: Comma separated list of namespaces to monitor in non-privileged mode. This parameter is unnecessary if the kube-state-metrics has ClusterRole on all namespaces.

nodeSelector.description: Defines nodes the kube-state-merics are scheduled to.

priorityClassName.description: PriorityClassName assigned to the Pods to prevent them from eviction.

resources.description: Compute resources requests and limits. More info:https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/

runAsUser.description: The UID to run the entrypoint of the container process. Defaults to user specified in image metadata if unspecified.

fsGroup.description: A special supplemental group that applies to all containers in a pod.

annotations.description: Annotations is an unstructured key value map stored with a resource that may be set by external tools to store and retrieve arbitrary metadata. They are not queryable and should be preserved when modifying objects.

labels.description: Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) objects. May match selectors of replication controllers and services.

scrapeTimeout.description: Scrape timeout (must be less than interval)

metricRelabelings.description: Metric relabeling rules for filtering/processing scraped metrics

action.description: Relabel action (keep, drop, replace, labelmap, labeldrop, labelkeep, hashmod, labelreplace)

relabelings.description: Target relabeling rules for service discovery

items.description: Prometheus relabel_config rule for service discovery

scrapeResources.description: Comma-separated list of Resources to be enabled.

tolerations.description: Tolerations allow the pods to schedule onto nodes with matching taints.

metricRelabelings.description: Metric relabeling rules for filtering/processing scraped metrics

annotations.description: Annotations is an unstructured key value map stored with a resource that may be set by external tools to store and retrieve arbitrary metadata. They are not queryable and should be preserved when modifying objects. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/annotations

image.description: A docker image to use for monitoring-operator deployment.

imagePullSecrets.description: Kubernetes secret name storing a secret to pull images from private registry

labels.description: Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) objects. May match selectors of replication controllers and services. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/labels

name.description: A name that will be used in monitoring-operator related objects (deployment, service, role, etc.)

nodeSelector.description: Defines nodes the pod will be scheduled on.

metricRelabelings.description: Metric relabeling is applied to samples as the last step before ingestion.

relabelings.description: Allows to dynamically rewrite the label set of a target before it gets scraped. Ref: https://prometheus.io/docs/prometheus/latest/configuration/configuration/#relabel_config

install.description: Indicates if monitoring-operator has pprof enabled.

annotations.description: Set of annotations to assign to pprof service

labels.description: Set of labels to assign to pprof service

port.description: A pprof dedicated service port number

portName.description: A pprof dedicated service port name.

priorityClassName.description: PriorityClassName assigned to the pod to prevent them from eviction.

runAsUser.description: The UID to run the entrypoint of the container process. Defaults to user specified in image metadata if unspecified.

fsGroup.description: A special supplemental group that applies to all containers in a pod.

tolerations.description: Allows the pod to be scheduled onto nodes with matching taints.

nameOverride.description: Provide a name in place of monitoring-operator for `app:` labels

annotations.description: Annotations is an unstructured key value map stored with a resource that may be set by external tools to store and retrieve arbitrary metadata. They are not queryable and should be preserved when modifying objects. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/annotations

collectorTextfileDirectory.description: Directory for textfile collector. More info: https://github.com/prometheus/node_exporter#textfile-collector

labels.description: Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) objects. May match selectors of replication controllers and services. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/labels

nodeSelector.description: Defines nodes the pod is scheduled on.

port.description: Port for node-exporter daemonset and service

priorityClassName.description: PriorityClassName assigned to the Pods to prevent them from eviction.

cpu.description: Maximum amount of cpu resource that is allowed to be used by the container process per 1 scheduling period (100ms). Can be integer cores or milicores, e.g. 500m

memory.description: Maximum amount of memory that can be allocated to a container process. Can be expressed as a plain integer or as a fixed-point number using one of these quantity suffixes: E, P, T, G, M, k. You can also use the power-of-two equivalents: Ei, Pi, Ti, Gi, Mi, Ki.

cpu.description: Initial and guaranteed amount of cpu resource that is allowed to be used by the container process per 1 scheduling period (100ms). Can be integer cores or milicores, e.g. 500m

memory.description: Initial and guaranteed amount of memory that can be allocated to a container process. Can be expressed as a plain integer or as a fixed-point number using one of these quantity suffixes: E, P, T, G, M, k. You can also use the power-of-two equivalents: Ei, Pi, Ti, Gi, Mi, Ki.

runAsUser.description: The UID to run the entrypoint of the container process. Defaults to user specified in image metadata if unspecified.

fsGroup.description: A special supplemental group that applies to all containers in a pod.

setupSecurityContext.description: Allows to create PodSecurityPolicy or SecurityContextConstraints.

tolerations.description: Tolerations allow the pods to schedule onto nodes with matching taints.

prometheusAdapter.description: Adapter to support HPA scaling by custom metrics from VictoriaMetrics or Prometheus

promitorAgentResourceDiscovery.description: Resource discovery part of Promitor to discover hosts and other objects in Azure

promitorAgentScraper.description: Exporter to request metrics from Azure Monitor about different Azure Managed Services

promxy.description: Proxy to VictoriaMetrics or Prometheus datasources, use in DR deployments.

publicCloudName.description: Allows to disable or enable specific dashboards, rules and service monitors for the specified public cloud.

annotations.description: Annotations is an unstructured key value map stored with a resource that may be set by external tools to store and retrieve arbitrary metadata. They are not queryable and should be preserved when modifying objects. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/annotations

extraArgs.description: Additional pushgateway container arguments. Type: list[string]

annotations.description: Set of annotations for Ingress. Allows to set up authorization e.g. via ingress-nginx.

labels.description: Set of labels for Ingress. Default monitoring-operator labels can be overwritten.

tlsSecretName.description: Name of secret with TLS configs: tls.crt and tls.key. The secret must exist

labels.description: Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) objects. May match selectors of replication controllers and services. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/labels

nodeSelector.description: Defines nodes the pod is scheduled on.

port.description: Port for pushgateway deployment and service.

cpu.description: Maximum amount of cpu resource that is allowed to be used by the container process per 1 scheduling period (100ms). Can be integer cores or milicores, e.g. 500m

memory.description: Maximum amount of memory that can be allocated to a container process. Can be expressed as a plain integer or as a fixed-point number using one of these quantity suffixes: E, P, T, G, M, k. You can also use the power-of-two equivalents: Ei, Pi, Ti, Gi, Mi, Ki.

cpu.description: Initial and guaranteed amount of cpu resource that is allowed to be used by the container process per 1 scheduling period (100ms). Can be integer cores or milicores, e.g. 500m

memory.description: Initial and guaranteed amount of memory that can be allocated to a container process. Can be expressed as a plain integer or as a fixed-point number using one of these quantity suffixes: E, P, T, G, M, k. You can also use the power-of-two equivalents: Ei, Pi, Ti, Gi, Mi, Ki.

runAsUser.description: The UID to run the entrypoint of the container process. Defaults to user specified in image metadata if unspecified.

fsGroup.description: A special supplemental group that applies to all containers in a pod.

storage.description: PVC spec for Pushgateway. If specified, also adds flags --persistence.file=/data/pushgateway.data and --persistence.interval=5m, creates volume and volumeMount with name "storage-volume" in the deployment.

tolerations.description: Tolerations allow the pods to schedule onto nodes with matching taints.

volumeMounts.description: VolumeMounts allows configuration of additional VolumeMounts on the output StatefulSet definition. VolumeMounts specified will be appended to other VolumeMounts in the prometheus container, that are generated as a result of StorageSpec objects. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/generated/kubernetes-api/v1.18/#volumemount-v1-core

volumes.description: Volumes allows configuration of additional volumes on the output StatefulSet definition. Volumes specified will be appended to other volumes that are generated as a result of StorageSpec objects. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/generated/kubernetes-api/v1.18/#volume-v1-core

roleBinding.description: Role and ClusterRole for monitoring-operator to use. Ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/access-authn-authz/rbac/

stackdriver_exporter.description: Exporter to request metrics from Google Cloud Operations about different Google Managed Services.

versionExporter.description: Exporter to discover all versions for all applications from ConfigMap
